bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Brothers George and Erasmus Hopkins served in the Virginia Infantry, Corse's Brigade, York Rangers, Co. I., 32nd Regiment, and Caroline Grays, Co. E, 30th Regiment, respectively, during the Civil War. Their brother, Augustus, married Mary Kennon Wortham. Joe may have been their sister, Josephine (1830-1896).
Genealogical information on the Hopkins family can be found in Walter Lee Hopkins, Hopkins of Virginia and Related Families (Richmond, VA: J. W. Fergusson & Sons, 1931), p. 230- 231, 264.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection contains two promissory notes to hire slaves. One is from Edward Martin to Mrs. Mary K. Hopkins, and the other is from B. E. Meade to Dr. A. Hopkins. Two letters, written during the Civil War, from George Hopkins to Joe Hopkins and from Erasmus Hopkins to Joe Hopkins, contain news of a march to and from Fredericksburg on little food, Erasmus' detailing as assistant superintendent to build a dam, and inquiries into conditions at home. A third letter, from Major N. R. Fitzhugh to Captain George Hopkins encloses a receipt and a form to be filled in to pay for beef. The form is not included in the collection.
